events.title: Tactical Cat Deployment
events.description: {streamer}'s cat walked across the keyboard during a slow stream. Accidentally started a raid to a channel with 50,000 viewers. The cat is now more popular than {streamer}.

choices.text: Lean in. The cat gets its own emote.
Keep the cat off-camera. Maintain brand integrity.
Start a 'Cat Cam' subscription tier.

events.title: Tournament Invitation
events.description: {streamer} got invited to a major esports tournament. The prize pool is massive, but so is the competition. Their skill will be tested.

choices.text: Accept and train hard for it.
Decline gracefully. Not ready yet.
Accept but don't practice. Wing it.

events.title: Model Upgrade Offer
events.description: A famous rigger wants to upgrade {streamer}'s VTuber model for free in exchange for exposure. The new model looks incredible but would change their whole aesthetic.

choices.text: Accept the upgrade. Evolution is necessary.
Keep the current model. The fans love it.
Commission a completely new design instead.

events.title: Location Compromised
events.description: Someone figured out where {streamer} was streaming from and posted it online. Fans are showing up. This needs to be handled carefully.

choices.text: Address it calmly and set boundaries.
Go dark for a week. Safety first.
Turn it into content. 'Fan meetup' stream.

events.title: Cover Goes Viral
events.description: {streamer}'s cover of a popular song is blowing up. A record label has reached out, but they want exclusive rights.

choices.text: Sign with the label. Go pro.
Stay independent. Keep creative control.
Negotiate harder. They need us more.

events.title: Audience Requests
events.description: ASMR viewers are requesting increasingly specific triggers. Some are... creative. {streamer} needs to decide where the line is.

choices.text: Stick to safe, classic triggers.
Experiment with new content types.
Create a premium tier for special requests.

events.title: Copyright Claim
events.description: {streamer}'s reaction video caught a DMCA claim. The content owner is demanding the video be taken down and wants compensation.

choices.text: Fight it. This is fair use.
Take it down and apologize.
Negotiate a licensing deal.

events.title: Fact Check Failed
events.description: {streamer} accidentally spread some misinformation in their latest video. The comments are not happy. Experts are weighing in.

choices.text: Issue a detailed correction immediately.
Double down. The 'experts' are wrong.
Quietly edit the video and hope no one notices.

events.title: Transformation Challenge
events.description: A brand wants to sponsor {streamer} for a 90-day transformation challenge. Great money, but intense commitment.

choices.text: Accept the challenge. Content gold.
Decline. Not worth the pressure.
Counter-offer for a shorter challenge.

events.title: Art Stolen
events.description: Someone is selling prints of {streamer}'s original artwork without permission. It's been going on for months.

choices.text: Legal action. Lawyer up.
Call them out publicly.
Let it go. Not worth the energy.

events.title: Burnout Signs
events.description: {streamer} has been pushing too hard. They're showing signs of exhaustion. Viewers have noticed the decline in energy.

choices.text: Take a week off. Mental health first.
Push through. The grind doesn't stop.
Reduce to part-time streaming temporarily.

events.title: Drama Brewing
events.description: Another creator is subtweeting about {streamer}. The community is waiting to see if they'll respond. Engagement is spiking.

choices.text: Take the high road. Ignore it.
Respond with fire. Time to clap back.
Make a meme about it. Defuse with humor.

events.title: Parasocial Problem
events.description: A long-time supporter is becoming too attached. They're in {streamer}'s chat every stream, DMing constantly, and getting upset when not acknowledged.

choices.text: Set clear boundaries publicly.
Quietly ban them. No explanation needed.
Keep engaging. They're a big supporter.

events.title: Collaboration Offer
events.description: A creator with 10x {streamer}'s following wants to collab. Great exposure, but {streamer} will definitely be the 'smaller' one.

choices.text: Accept eagerly. Growth opportunity!
Decline. Build your own audience first.
Counter-propose a different format where you're equals.

events.title: Competing Sponsors
events.description: Two competing brands both want {streamer} as an ambassador. One pays more, the other aligns better with their values.

choices.text: Take the money. Business is business.
Go with values. Authenticity matters.
Try to negotiate with both.

events.title: Sponsor Relations Update
events.description: {streamer} said 'hey guys' on stream. Three sponsors have requested an urgent call about 'audience alignment' and 'inclusive greeting strategy.' One has already sent a 47-page brand guidelines PDF.

choices.text: Schedule the calls. Nod a lot. Say 'absolutely.'
Switch to 'hey gamers' and hope no one notices.
Ignore. They need us more than we need them.

events.title: Generous Feedback
events.description: A viewer donated $5 to {streamer} with a 2,000-word message about their life philosophy, cryptocurrency predictions, and unsolicited dating advice. The TTS read the entire thing. Twice.

choices.text: Thank them sincerely. Content is content.
Set a character limit on donations immediately.
Make it a recurring segment: 'Manifesto Mondays.'

events.title: Content Strategy Pivot
events.description: {streamer} played the wrong game for 6 hours. Chat didn't say anything because 'the vibes were good.' Viewership was actually up 40%. Nobody knows what game it was.

choices.text: Never acknowledge it. Play wrong games forever.
Ask chat what game it was. Turn it into a bit.
Stick to the schedule. Consistency matters.

events.title: Algorithmic Blessing
events.description: The Platform pushed {streamer} to the front page for 3 hours. No one knows why. Engagement is through the roof. A platform rep emailed asking {streamer} to 'keep doing whatever that was.'

choices.text: Reply asking what 'that' was. Get no response.
Pretend to know. Nod confidently in meetings.
Hire a consultant to figure it out. ($800)

events.title: Discourse Participation
events.description: {streamer} tweeted a mild opinion about pizza toppings. It has 2 million impressions and rising. Several gaming news sites want a statement. Someone made a YouTube video essay.

choices.text: Double down. Pizza opinions are a hill to die on.
Delete tweet. Touch grass. Log off for a week.
Pivot to food content. Strike while iron is hot.

events.title: Networking Update
events.description: {streamer} scheduled a collab with a bigger creator. They got ghosted. Then un-ghosted. Then ghosted again. The collab is technically 'still happening' according to their manager's manager.

choices.text: Wait patiently. Big creators are busy.
Subtweet vaguely. 'Some people, man.'
Move on. Collab with someone who shows up.

events.title: Merchandise Situation
events.description: 500 units of {streamer}'s new merch shipped with a typo. The shirt says 'STEAM LORD' instead of 'STREAM LORD.' They're selling faster than the correct ones.

choices.text: Recall them. Brand integrity matters.
Limited edition. Charge double.
Rebrand entirely. We're Steam Lords now.

events.title: Raid Train Incoming
events.description: {streamer} got included in a 12-hour charity raid train. They were asleep. The raid came anyway. Chat watched them sleep for 40 minutes before anyone realized.

choices.text: Embrace the 'sleeping stream' arc. ASMR adjacent.
Apologize profusely. Re-stream the VOD wide awake.
Never acknowledge it happened. Gaslight chat.

events.title: Emote Controversy
events.description: {streamer}'s new sub emote looks vaguely like a popular competitor's logo. Nobody noticed for 3 months. Now it's trending on Twitter and lawyers are 'looking into it.'

choices.text: Replace the emote immediately. Legal is scary.
Claim it's parody. Fair use, baby.
Make it look MORE like the logo. Assert dominance.

events.title: Algorithm Betrayal
events.description: YeTube stopped recommending {streamer}'s videos overnight. Views dropped 80%. The official response: 'Our systems are working as intended.' They did not elaborate.

choices.text: Pivot hard. New content, new thumbnail style, new everything.
Make a 45-minute video complaining about the algorithm.
Wait it out. Algorithms are mysterious but temporary.

events.title: Shorts Lottery Winner
events.description: A 30-second clip of {streamer} saying 'what' in a funny way got 5 million views on YeTube Shorts. Comments are asking who this person is. The main channel has not benefited at all.

choices.text: Pivot to Shorts. Chase the algorithm.
Ignore it. Focus on long-form content.
Say 'what' in every video now. It's a bit.

events.title: Copyright Claim Roulette
events.description: {streamer}'s video got claimed for 3 seconds of silence that allegedly matches a copyrighted song. The claimant is a company that doesn't seem to exist.

choices.text: Dispute it. You recorded that silence yourself.
Accept the claim. It's not worth the hassle.
Make a video about it. Copyright drama gets views.

events.title: Tier List Tension
events.description: Subscribers keep asking {streamer} to add content to the higher tier that wasn't part of the deal. The requests are getting more... creative. And more frequent.

choices.text: Hard boundary. Reiterate what the tiers include.
Add a new tier. Meet in the middle. More money.
Block the most demanding ones. Quality over quantity.

events.title: Content Containment Breach
events.description: Some of {streamer}'s exclusive content got leaked to a free site. It's been up for a week. They found out from a viewer who 'stumbled across it.'

choices.text: DMCA everything. Lawyer up. Full scorched earth.
Watermark everything going forward. Learn and adapt.
Post about it publicly. Shame works sometimes.

events.title: Big Spender Alert
events.description: A new subscriber tipped {streamer} $2,000 in one day. No message. No requests. Just... tips. They've been completely silent. It's unsettling.

choices.text: Say thank you publicly. Normal business.
DM to check in. Make sure they're okay.
Refund it. Something feels wrong.
